intro: Androcalva loxophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers.
